text.p: Hurricane Fran threatens the northwestern Bahamas and USA Southeast. A hurricane warning is in effect for the northwestern Bahamas. A hurricane watch is in effect for the central Bahamas where there is also a tropical storm warning up. A hurricane watch has been issued from north of Sebastian Inlet, Florida, to Little River Inlet, South Carolina. Fran has top winds of 115 mph and is centered 255 miles east northeast of Nassau, Bahamas, moving west northwest at 12 mph. Fran will bring strong winds, rain, and squalls to the northern Bahamas. Fran is also a major threat to shipping.

The extratropical remains of Edouard will be a threat to some shipping in the northern Atlantic in the waters southeast to east of Nova Scotia this period. Rough seas and strong winds will be the rule.

In the eastern Pacific, Tropical Strom Elida is making a close pass to southern Baja. Tropical storm warnings are up from San Jose Del Cabo to Cabo San Lazaro. Elida has 65 mph top winds and is centered 110 miles southwest of Cabo San Lucas, moving northwest at 7 mph. Tropical storm conditions with heavy squalls will occur through the warned area.
There are no further statements at this time.
